First-year.name: Electrical
First-year.pun: We hope You Laugh Till it Hertz

DC Circuits: Voltage source and current source; Mesh and Nodal analysis
Transient response of series RL and RC circuits
Steady state analysis of DC Circuits: capacitor charging and discharging,  current-voltage relationship,  time-constant,  rise-time,  fall-time
inductor energisation and de-energisation,  inductance current-voltage relationship,  time-constant
Transient response of RL,  RC and RLC Circuits
AC Circuits: Sinusoidal sources,  RC,  RL and RLC circuits
Concept of Phasors,  Phasor representation of circuit elements
Single phase AC Series and parallel circuits
Resonance in series and parallel circuits
Balanced and unbalanced 3-phase circuit - voltage,  current and power relations
Comparison of single phase and three phase supply systems
Single Phase Transformers: phasor analysis and calculation of performance indices

comments: Electrical is one subject that should be prepared before the reading week.It is a numerical based subject so solve as many questions as possible. Derivations do come in exams. Better be on the safer side.
The best book for theory can be Hughes.Contains a lot of info that is more than enough to score above 80 in EST.

First-year.name: Environment

Biodiversity: Endangered and endemic species of India
Pollution: effects and control measures of the pollution – Air
Marine and Thermal and Nuclear Pollution
Role of Individual in Prevention of Pollution
Human Population and the Environment: IT in human health and environment

comments: Refer to extra information points too on the very same topics and episodes from the text and slides, Google a bit and write the correct things in exams.
Focus more on Qualitative Information as compared to Quantitative Facts

First-year.name: Mechanics

Plane trusses: Forces in members of a truss by method of joints and method of sections
Virtual work: calculation of virtual displacement and virtual work

comments: Tutorials are a must for this course

First-year.name: Mathematics I

Application of Derivatives: Monotonic Functions and the First Derivative Test
Sequence and Series: Alternating Series, Absoulute and Conditional Convergence
Partial Differentiation: Limits and Continuity in Higher Dimensions
Multiple Integrals: Double and Iterated Integrals over Rectangles

comments: Just know how to solve each type of problem which exists in previous year papers and tutorials
Dont forget to learn the derivations, they are IMPORTANT
Follow Thomas and Finney 9th Edition strictly.

C Language: Life Cycle of Program from Source code to Executable
Functions: showcase stack usage with help of debugger
Arrays, Strings and Pointers: Interfunction communication via arrays: ['Passing a row', 'Passing the entire array', 'Matrices']

First-year.name: Applied Chemistry

Electrochemistry: ​Specific, equivalent and molar conductivity of electrolytic solutions
Transference number and its determination by Hittorf`s method
Water Treatment and Analysis: ​Hardness and alkalinity of water:Units and determination
External and internal method of softening of water: carbonate, phosphate, calgon and colloidal conditioning, Lime-soda Process, Zeolite process, Ion exchange process, mixed bed deionizer
Fuels: Comparison of solid liquid and gaseous fuels
Alternative fuels: biofuels, power alcohol, synthetic petrol
Chemistry of Polymers: Conducting, biodegradable polymers and inorganic polymers.
Molecular Spectroscopy​: principle, instrumentation and applications of UV-Vis and IR spectroscopy

comments: Try to elaborate your answers in exams.(just to increase the length ;)
Slides are enough, But for tricky topics (Such as: Phase rule), books can surely come in handy.
